text: Byron Raymond White (June 8, 1917 â€“ April 15, 2002) was an American judge and former football player. he served as an associate justice of the Supreme Court of the United States. He was appointed to the court by President John F. Kennedy in 1962. He retired in 1993. Before becoming an associate justice, White played for the Pittsburgh Pirates (now Steelers) in 1938 and for the Detroit Lions from 1940 to 1941. He played as a halfback. White died in Denver, Colorado from pneumonia, aged 84. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1917 births Category:2002 deaths Category:United States Supreme Court justices Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Lawyers from Colorado Category:Detroit Lions players Category:Disease-related deaths in Colorado Category:Pittsburgh Pirates players Category:Politicians from Colorado Category:Sportspeople from Colorado Category:United States Deputy Attorneys General
title: Byron White
